title: § 164.508 Uses and disclosures for which an authorization is required
description: The system shall require that a valid authorization for use or disclosure of protected health information contain at least the following elements: (i) A description of the information to be used or disclosed that identifies the information in a specific and meaningful fashion. (ii) The name or other specific identification of the person(s), or class of persons, authorized to make the requested use or disclosure. (iii) The name or other specific identification of the person(s), or class of persons, to whom the covered entity may make the requested use or disclosure. (iv) A description of each purpose of the requested use or disclosure. The statement “at the request of the individual” is a sufficient description of the purpose when an individual initiates the authorization and does not, or elects not to, provide a statement of the purpose. (v) An expiration date or an expiration event that relates to the individual or the purpose of the use or disclosure. The statement “end of the research study,” “none,” or similar language is sufficient if the authorization is for a use or disclosure of protected health information for research, including for the creation and maintenance of a research database or research repository. (vi) Signature of the individual and date. If the authorization is signed by a personal representative of the individual, a description of such representative's authority to act for the individual must also be provided.

description: The system shall ensure that each authorization states whether payment is conditioned on signing the authorization, and if so, what the consequences are.

title: § 164.508 Uses and disclosures for which an authorization is required
description: The system shall ensure that each authorization states whether enrollment is conditioned on signing the authorization, and if so, what the consequences are.

title: § 164.508 Uses and disclosures for which an authorization is required
description: The system shall ensure that each authorization states whether eligibility for benefits is conditioned on signing the authorization, and if so, what the consequences are.

title: § 164.508 Uses and disclosures for which an authorization is required
description: The system shall ensure that each authorization includes a statement that information disclosed under the authorization may be redisclosed by the recipient and may no longer be protected.

title: § 164.508 Uses and disclosures for which an authorization is required
description: The system shall ensure that each authorization is written in plain language.

title: § 164.508 Uses and disclosures for which an authorization is required
description: The system shall ensure that a copy of the signed authorization is provided to the individual when an authorization is requested for use or disclosure of protected health information.

title: § 164.514 Other requirements relating to uses and disclosures of protected health information
description: The system shall ensure that any code or other means of record identification used to re-identify information that has been de-identified is not derived from or related to information about the individual and is not otherwise capable of being translated so as to identify the individual.

title: § 164.514 Other requirements relating to uses and disclosures of protected health information
description: The system shall ensure that the covered entity does not use or disclose the code or other means of record identification for any other purpose, and does not disclose the mechanism for re-identification.

title: § 164.514 Other requirements relating to uses and disclosures of protected health information
description: The system must implement policies and procedures that limit the amount of protected health information disclosed during routine and recurring disclosures to only what is reasonably necessary to achieve the disclosure’s purpose.

title: § 164.514 Other requirements relating to uses and disclosures of protected health information
description: The system must ensure that the data use agreement prohibits the recipient from identifying the information or contacting the individuals who are the subjects of the limited data set.

title: § 164.514 Other requirements relating to uses and disclosures of protected health information
description: The system must ensure that, before disclosing protected health information, the identity and authority of the person requesting the information are verified if the identity or authority are not already known.

title: § 164.514 Other requirements relating to uses and disclosures of protected health information
description: The system must allow reliance on documentation, statements, or representations submitted by a requester if the materials appear to meet applicable requirements and reliance is reasonable under the circumstances.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that individuals receive adequate notice of the uses and disclosures of protected health information that may be made by the covered entity.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that individuals receive adequate notice of the individuals’ rights.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that individuals receive adequate notice of the covered entity’s legal duties regarding protected health information.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that individuals who are the subjects of records related to substance use disorder treatment receive adequate notice of the uses and disclosures of those records.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that individuals who are the subjects of records related to substance use disorder treatment receive adequate notice of their rights.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that individuals who are the subjects of records related to substance use disorder treatment receive adequate notice of the covered entity’s legal duties with respect to those records.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that an individual enrolled in a group health plan receives a notice of privacy practices from the health insurance issuer or Health Maintenance Organization (HMO) if the individual receives health benefits under the plan through that issuer or HMO.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that a group health plan providing health benefits solely through an insurance contract, and that creates or receives protected health information beyond summary health information or enrollment status, maintains a notice of privacy practices.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that any group health plan required to maintain a notice of privacy practices must provide the notice to any person upon request.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that inmates do not receive a notice of privacy practices and that correctional institutions acting as covered entities are not subject to the notice requirements.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that the notice of privacy practices is written in plain language and includes all required elements.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that the notice of privacy practices includes the following prominently displayed statement:“THIS NOTICE DESCRIBES HOW MEDICAL INFORMATION ABOUT YOU MAY BE USED AND DISCLOSED AND HOW YOU CAN GET ACCESS TO THIS INFORMATION. PLEASE REVIEW IT CAREFULLY.”

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that the notice of privacy practices contains a description, including at least one example, of the types of uses and disclosures permitted for treatment, payment, and health care operations.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that the notice of privacy practices includes a description of each other purpose for which protected health information may be used or disclosed without the individual’s written authorization.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that the notice of privacy practices reflects any prohibition or material limitation on uses or disclosures imposed by other applicable law, and that the description reflects the stricter standard when required.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that each description of permitted or required use or disclosure includes sufficient detail to notify the individual of how their information may be used or disclosed.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that the notice of privacy practices describes the types of uses and disclosures that require written authorization, includes a statement that any other uses or disclosures will only be made with written authorization, and informs the individual of their right to revoke that authorization.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that the notice of privacy practices includes a description, with at least one example, of the types of uses and disclosures that are prohibited, written in sufficient detail for individuals to understand the prohibition.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that the notice of privacy practices includes a description, with at least one example, of the types of uses and disclosures that require an attestation.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that the notice of privacy practices contains a statement informing individuals that information disclosed may be subject to redisclosure by the recipient and may no longer be protected.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that if the covered entity intends to contact individuals for fundraising purposes, the notice of privacy practices includes a separate statement informing individuals of their right to opt out of receiving such communications.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that if a group health plan, health insurance issuer, or Health Maintenance Organization (HMO) intends to disclose protected health information to a plan sponsor, the notice of privacy practices includes a separate statement informing individuals of this practice.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that if a health plan intends to use or disclose protected health information for underwriting purposes, the notice of privacy practices includes a separate statement informing individuals that genetic information may not be used or disclosed for those purposes.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that the notice of privacy practices includes a statement informing individuals of their right to request restrictions on certain uses and disclosures of protected health information (i.e., treatment, payment, or health care operations), along with a clarification that the covered entity is not required to agree to such requests.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that the notice of privacy practices informs individuals of their right to request to receive protected health information through confidential communications.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that the notice of privacy practices informs individuals of their right to inspect and obtain a copy of their protected health information.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that the notice of privacy practices informs individuals of their right to request an amendment to their protected health information.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that the notice of privacy practices informs individuals of their right to receive a record of disclosures of their protected health information.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that the notice of privacy practices informs individuals of their right to request and receive a paper copy of the notice, even if they previously agreed to receive it electronically.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that the notice of privacy practices includes a statement that the covered entity is required by law to maintain the privacy of protected health information, to provide individuals with notice of its legal duties and privacy practices, and to notify affected individuals in the event of a breach involving unsecured protected health information.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that the notice of privacy practices includes a statement that the covered entity is required to follow the terms of the notice currently in effect.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that the notice of privacy practices includes a statement that the covered entity reserves the right to change the terms of its notice and apply those changes to all protected health information it maintains, including information created or received before the change. The notice must describe how individuals will be informed of any revised notice.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that the notice of privacy practices includes a statement informing individuals that they may file a complaint with the covered entity and with the Secretary if they believe their privacy rights have been violated. The notice must briefly explain how to file a complaint with the covered entity and state that individuals will not be retaliated against for filing a complaint.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that the notice of privacy practices includes the name or title, and telephone number, of a person or office that individuals may contact for more information.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that the notice of privacy practices includes the date it first becomes effective, which must not be earlier than the date on which the notice is printed or published.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that the notice of privacy practices is available upon request to any person and to individuals as required.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that a health plan provides the notice of privacy practices to individuals covered by the plan no later than the compliance date and to new enrollees at the time of enrollment.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that a health plan notifies individuals of the availability of the notice of privacy practices and how to obtain it at least once every three years.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that, when a material change is made to the notice of privacy practices and the health plan does not post its notice on a website, the health plan provides the revised notice, or information about the material change and how to obtain the revised notice, to individuals covered by the plan at that time within 60 days of the material revision.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that a health care provider with a direct treatment relationship provides the notice no later than the date of the first service delivery, or as soon as reasonably practicable after emergency treatment.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that the health care provider makes a good faith effort to obtain written acknowledgment of receipt of the notice.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that, when the covered health care provider maintains a physical service delivery site, the notice of privacy practices is available at the service delivery site for individuals to request to take with them.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that, when the covered health care provider maintains a physical service delivery site, the notice of privacy practices is posted in a clear and prominent location where individuals seeking service from the covered health care provider can reasonably be expected to read the notice.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that when a covered entity maintains a website that provides information about its customer services or benefits, the covered entity prominently posts its notice on the website and makes the notice available electronically through the website.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that the covered entity may provide the required notice to an individual by email only if the individual has agreed to electronic notice and has not withdrawn that agreement.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that a paper copy of the notice is provided, If the covered entity knows that the email transmission has failed.

title: § 164.520 Notice of privacy practices for protected health information
description: The system must ensure that an individual who receives electronic notice retains the right to obtain a paper copy of the notice from the covered entity upon request.

title: § 164.522 Rights to request privacy protection for protected health information
description: The system must allow individuals to request restrictions on the use or disclosure of their protected health information for treatment operations.

title: § 164.522 Rights to request privacy protection for protected health information
description: The system must allow individuals to request restrictions on the use or disclosure of their protected health information for payment operations.

title: § 164.522 Rights to request privacy protection for protected health information
description: The system must allow individuals to request restrictions on the use or disclosure of their protected health information for health care operations.

title: § 164.522 Rights to request privacy protection for protected health information
description: The system must allow restricted protected health information to be used or disclosed to a health care provider for emergency treatment when necessary and must include a request to the provider not to further use or disclose the information.

title: § 164.522 Rights to request privacy protection for protected health information
description: The system must retain documentation of any agreed-upon restrictions.

title: § 164.522 Rights to request privacy protection for protected health information
description: The system must allow individuals to request confidential communications from a health plan and must accommodate the request if the individual states that disclosure could endanger them.

title: § 164.522 Rights to request privacy protection for protected health information
description: The system may require that a request for confidential communication be made in writing.

title: § 164.522 Rights to request privacy protection for protected health information
description: The system may require individuals to provide information on how payment will be handled and to specify an alternative address or contact method when requesting confidential communication.

title: § 164.522 Rights to request privacy protection for protected health information
description: The system must not require individuals to explain the reason for requesting confidential communication from a health care provider.

title: § 164.522 Rights to request privacy protection for protected health information
description: The system may require that a request to a health plan for confidential communication include a statement that disclosure could endanger the individual.

title: § 164.524 Access of individuals to protected health information
description: The system must allow an individual to inspect and obtain a copy of their protected health information maintained in a designated record set, for as long as the information is maintained in that set.

title: § 164.524 Access of individuals to protected health information
description: The system must not allow individuals to access psychotherapy notes as part of their right to access protected health information.

title: § 164.524 Access of individuals to protected health information
description: The system must not allow individuals to access perotected health information compiled in reasonable anticipation of, or for use in, a civil, criminal, or administrative action or proceeding.

title: § 164.524 Access of individuals to protected health information
description: The system must allow denial of access to an inmate’s protected health information, in whole or in part, if providing access would jeopardize the health, safety, security, custody, or rehabilitation of the individual or others, or the safety of staff or transport personnel.

title: § 164.524 Access of individuals to protected health information
description: The system must allow temporary denial of access to protected health information obtained during a research study that includes treatment, if the individual agreed to the denial when consenting to participate and is informed that access will be restored after the research concludes.

title: § 164.524 Access of individuals to protected health information
description: The system must allow denial of access to protected health information in records subject to the Privacy Act if the denial meets the requirements of that law.

title: § 164.524 Access of individuals to protected health information
description: The system must allow denial of access to protected health information received from a source under a promise of confidentiality, if providing access would likely reveal the source of the information.

title: § 164.524 Access of individuals to protected health information
description: The system must allow a denial of access to protected health information if a licensed health care professional determines, using professional judgment, that the requested access is reasonably likely to endanger the life or physical safety of the individual or another person.

title: § 164.524 Access of individuals to protected health information
description: The system must allow a denial of access to protected health information that references another person (excluding health care providers), if a licensed health care professional determines that access is reasonably likely to cause substantial harm to that other person.

title: § 164.524 Access of individuals to protected health information
description: The system must allow a denial of access when the request is made by the individual’s personal representative and a licensed health care professional determines that granting access is reasonably likely to cause substantial harm to the individual or another person.

title: § 164.524 Access of individuals to protected health information
description: The system must ensure that individuals have the right to request a review of any denial made on the basis of risk or harm, and that a designated licensed health care professional who was not involved in the original denial makes a determination.

title: § 164.524 Access of individuals to protected health information
description: The system must ensure that access is either granted or denied based on the final determination made by the reviewing official assigned to evaluate the denial.

title: § 164.524 Access of individuals to protected health information
description: The system must allow individuals to request access to inspect or obtain a copy of protected health information about themselves that is maintained in a designated record set.

title: § 164.524 Access of individuals to protected health information
description: The system must ensure that any request for access to protected health information is acted upon within 30 days of receipt, either by granting access or issuing a written denial.

title: § 164.524 Access of individuals to protected health information
description: The system must ensure that if access is granted, in whole or in part, the individual is notified of the acceptance and provided with the requested access.

title: § 164.524 Access of individuals to protected health information
description: The system must provide the requested access in the form and format specified by the individual, if readily producible. If it is not readily producible, the information must be provided in a readable hard copy or another format agreed upon by the individual and the covered entity.

title: § 164.524 Access of individuals to protected health information
description: The system must provide access in the electronic form and format requested by the individual if the information is maintained electronically and it is readily producible. If it is not readily producible in the requested format, it must be provided in another readable electronic format agreed upon by the individual and the covered entity.

title: § 164.524 Access of individuals to protected health information
description: The system may provide a summary or explanation of the requested protected health information instead of full access, only if the individual agrees to receive a summary or explanation in advance and agrees to any fees associated with it.

title: § 164.524 Access of individuals to protected health information
description: The system must ensure that access to protected health information is provided in a timely manner, including offering to arrange a convenient time and place for inspection or mailing the information if requested. The system must also support discussions with the individual to clarify scope, format, or other access-related preferences.

title: § 164.524 Access of individuals to protected health information
description: The system must support an individual's request to transmit a copy of their protected health information directly to another person, provided the request is in writing, signed by the individual, and clearly identifies the recipient and the delivery location.

title: § 164.524 Access of individuals to protected health information
description: The system may allow the imposition of a reasonable, cost-based fee for copies, summaries, or explanations of protected health information. The fee must include only the cost of:Labor for copying the information in paper or electronic form, Supplies for creating the copy (e.g., paper or portable media), Postage, if the individual requests mailed delivery, and Preparation of a summary or explanation, if agreed to in advance.

title: § 164.524 Access of individuals to protected health information
description: The system must allow partial access to any requested protected health information not subject to denial, even if part of the request is denied.

title: § 164.524 Access of individuals to protected health information
description: The system must provide a timely, written denial in plain language when access is denied. The denial must include: The reason for the denial, A statement of the individual's right to request a review, if applicable, and how to exercise that right, and Instructions on how to file a complaint, including the name or title and telephone number of a designated contact person.

title: § 164.524 Access of individuals to protected health information
description: The system must maintain documentation of: The designated record sets subject to individual access rights, and The titles of personnel or offices responsible for receiving and handling such access requests.

title: § 164.526 Amendment of protected health information
description: The system must allow individuals to request an amendment to their protected health information maintained in designated record sets, for as long as the information is retained in those sets.

title: § 164.526 Amendment of protected health information
description: The system must allow the covered entity to deny an amendment request if: The information was not created by the entity, unless the originator is no longer available to amend it. The information is not part of the designated record set. The information is not eligible for access under the access provision. The information is already accurate and complete.

title: § 164.526 Amendment of protected health information
description: The system may require that amendment requests be submitted in writing and include a reason for the amendment, as long as individuals are informed of these requirements in advance.

title: § 164.526 Amendment of protected health information
description: The system must ensure that any request for amendment to protected health information is acted upon within 60 calendar days of receipt.

title: § 164.526 Amendment of protected health information
description: The system must allow the covered entity to make reasonable efforts to share accepted amendments with: Individuals/entities identified by the patient, Any third parties (including business associates) known to hold or rely on the original data.

title: § 164.526 Amendment of protected health information
description: The system must allow individuals to submit a written statement of disagreement and optionally allow covered entities to limit the length of such statements.

title: § 164.526 Amendment of protected health information
description: The system must allow the covered entity to issue a written rebuttal to the individual’s disagreement and ensure a copy is shared with the individual.

title: § 164.526 Amendment of protected health information
description: The system must ensure that all documents related to denied amendments (request, denial, disagreement, rebuttal) are: Appended or linked to the relevant protected health information record in the designated record set.

title: § 164.526 Amendment of protected health information
description: The system must record and retain The titles of persons or offices responsible for receiving and processing amendment requests
